data.title: Ms. Gini's 1st Classroom
data.header: Students identified communal classroom areas such as the rug space as a Green Space. However, areas such as our Library needed to have clearer expectations, as seen with the Pink Space.

data.title: Ms. Gini's 2nd Classroom
data.header: Students defined Pink Spaces as a “sad face,” or areas that did not make us happy. Table gropus are where students are for gropu projects and independent work, which make up a lot of class time. Check out our blog post about how this classroom teacher used maps to have meaningful discussions and create changes in her classroom with students.

data.title: Ms. Gini's 3rd Classroom
data.header: Students agreed that desks were a Green Space. We co-defined Green Spaces as places where “you can be yourself” and where we can feel 'comfortable.'
